comments:
I have a similar problem using m5.  I have been using e3 since m1 and I have 
started getting these couldn't create resource because resource already exists 
errors only in m5.  I tried switching back to m4 but had the same problem so I 
am back using m5.

The other problem is that an update used to take a max of around 3 minutes.  
Now my update is taking 9 minutes and I had 3 items that were new.  

I think this has to do with decorations, I see that the decoration progress 
intermitently appears during this process.  All I know is that it is almost 
unbarably slow especially with the above errors requiring me to continually 
repreform this update.
So I tried a few more things:

Update with Eclipse #1   13 minutes
Update with Eclipse #2   23 minutes
Update with Eclipse #3   9 minutes

Full checkout using wincvs:  5 minutes

Update with Eclipse #4   internal error will attach exception

cvs update with eclipse #5:  9 Minutes, even though the cvs console says:  
ok (took 2:16.071).  It was 9 minutes from the start of team->update until the 
progress dialog disappeared.

I'd agree quite a big slowdown from 2.1. Back then it ran in foreground and 3 
intended to improve by running it in the background.

However I think it must be single-threaded at least against CVS NT; and it 
looks like it spends about 50% of time blocking for authentication and only 50% 
doing actual processing.

I'm doing plugin development so I see with the threads thrashing away in my 
lower Workspace... these appear to be used single-shot per file, so this single 
thread popping up and down in the display has been a rather noticable focus of 
activity :-)

Could more worker threads or keeping threads & connections open improve this?

Ok, there's a bunch of issues discussed here:
1. Team > Update and Checkout taking longer

I've ran my own tests using project org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests.refactoring one 
of the largest projects on dev.eclipse.org/home/eclipse. The tests where run 
with build I20031211. These are the numbers I got:

setup:
  cvs server on RH Linus 2.2.16-22 server version 1.11.2)
  cvs label decorations turned on
  cvs console closed

checkout
  cvs cmd line      2:45min   
  eclipse I20031211 2:30min
  eclipse 2.1.2     2:00min

update 
  cvs cmd line      2:00min
  eclipse I20031211 1:20min
  eclipse 2.1.2     1:00min

We are a bit slower than 2.1.2 so far, but again we haven't optimized yet. 
However, I'm not seeing the same order of magnitude that you said you have 
seen. You didn't give many details about your setup though, so I can only 
guess that that's where we differ. We need more details to continue an 
investigation. The decorators could be affecting, and also because intermitent 
deltas are being dispatched so that you can browse your project as it is being 
checked out. So the timings don't surprise me much.

Also, I profiled the update and didn't find anything strange. 

2. Core exception

logged a bug against core. https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=48655

3. Authentication taking too long

Try the new ssh2 connection method. It re-uses connections :) It will be in 
M6, to enable goto the CVs > SSH2 preference page. We are not turning the ssh2 
connection method on by default until we have tested it a bit more.
Browsing project as it is being checked out?  Is this post m5?  I certainly
can't do that.  There is a modal dialog box preventing me from doing that.

Ok so the cvs server is 1.11.6 running redhat linux - not sure which version.

So I tried again,

cvs console was open.

unshare quick
refresh 5 minutes
reshare 15 minutes for decorations to finish
update 22 minutes (actually reported cvs time:  ok (took 20:35.866) )





updated again immediately after:

problem refreshing resource file already exists error.  I'll log this error to
bug 47382.  As well as the log file error message.

Our usual practice is to move bugs to the RESOLVED REMIND state when there is not enough information provided to address the reported issue and more information has been requested. This bug has been in the RESOLVED REMIND state for quite some time so it is being CLOSED. If you can provide the requested information or you otherwise feel that this is still an issue, please reopen the bug. If you are unable to open it due to a lack or permissions, please add a comment to the bug stating that you would like to have the request reconsidered.  I applogize for this blanket approach to bug screening but there are just to many bugs in the REMIND state for us to effectively triage them. Your help in this matter is appreciated.
